- PLACE TOMATO ON SPINACH.
- COVER WITH FOIL WRAP.
- BOARD IN DESIGNATED LOCATION.

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: RCV, CC, INTL, Receiving Charge

Component.ComponentDescription: Receiving Code

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: W Class is included in YC Pricing
Domestic - Domestic, Mexican, Caribbean and Latin
International - Europe, Latin Premium, Pacific Hawaii and TCon
Includes-
Ordering product and equipment via airline designated system; Receiving vendor
/supplier shipments at the receive dock; Removing of any shipping packaging
that occurs prior to storage in the warehouse; Moving of received product into
storage; Transporting and breaking down of items into bins from any storage
packaging as; necessary
Defrosting / decanting of frozen food items as necessary and planning in
intermediate are prior to pick-up for staging in food pre/plating/portioning
area(s); Shipping out any defective/excess product originally intended for
airline that; is not required for operations
Any support labor or activities for product receiving or related overhead not
explicitly referenced in facility overhead if applicable
Excludes-
Offloading of trucks that are bringing back catering carts from an incoming
flight; Warehousing facility/utility costs
Staging of food products or equipment in plating/portioning area

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: TSC, TSU PLUS 10

Component.ComponentDescription: TSC Servicing

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Includes
-Transporting and staging food and equipment components to the station to build
the TSU
- Placing one single discrete article onto a tray
- The tray counts as one discrete item
- Wrapping the plastic over the TSU
Excludes
- Placing food into a dish - covered in Plating charges associated with the dish
- Placing the TSU into a cart or similar as this is covered in other scheduled
serving codes
Examples of a single item include: Roll-up, Empty Bowl, Filled Bowl, Plastic
Wrap, Food placed directly on tray, the tray itself

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: PLT, APP, PP, DOMCC/INTLWC

Component.ComponentDescription: Service plating

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: PP In-house - single portion is plated onto a plate of either dishware.
PC - Ind. Portioned BP in-house - Singles portions are separated into separate
containers such as garnishes e.g. cup w/lid. Multiples can be portioned
into/onto a bag/tray
POP - Vendor item is decanted and boarded into another dish or vessel
BP - Not individually portioned -placed into a single tin or bag for plating
onboard
SS - Self Serve
Not Plated - if no activity performed then no portioning fee will be allocated
Included activities:
Staging of completed fully prepare food items in the plating area / Staging of
required plates/tins / cups used for portioning; Building completed entre
salad, appetizers in-house as applicable
Adding in-house components; Transferring a vendor item into the prescribed dish
Scooping ice cream or placing pre-packaged ice cream into a BP container,
fitting the drawer with dry ice and wrapping as prescribed; Individually
portioning sauces, dressings, soups, butters and toppings
BP breads, cookies and nuts into larger tins or similar; Building complimentary
snack boxes
Building self serve (SS) trays; Wrapping dish in designated wrap where
applicable
Staging completed plates/tins in racks or other hold are as required

containers such as garnishes e.g. cup w/lid. Multiples can be portioned
into/onto a bag/tray
POP - Vendor item is decanted and boarded into another dish or vessel
BP - Not individually portioned -placed into a single tin or bag for plating
onboard
SS - Self Serve
Not Plated - if no activity performed then no portioning fee will be allocated
Included activities:
Staging of completed fully prepare food items in the plating area / Staging of
required plates/tins / cups used for portioning; Building completed entre
salad, appetizers in-house as applicable
Adding in-house components; Transferring a vendor item into the prescribed dish
Scooping ice cream or placing pre-packaged ice cream into a BP container,
fitting the drawer with dry ice and wrapping as prescribed; Individually
portioning sauces, dressings, soups, butters and toppings
BP breads, cookies and nuts into larger tins or similar; Building complimentary
snack boxes
Building self serve (SS) trays; Wrapping dish in designated wrap where
applicable
Staging completed plates/tins in racks or other hold are as required

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: BOND, PER FLT CHG, FEE, ALL COS

Component.ComponentDescription: BONDED SERVICE

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - Bonded liquor handling is priced as a single fixed charge per catered segment
in which bonded product is scheduled.
- Charge is applied on a per segment basis for all classes provided.

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: ORIG, ORIGINATOR ADDITIONAL LOAD SERVICES SCHEDULED

Component.ComponentDescription: Service Other Transprtation

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Included activities:
- Additional staging and validation for coffee brew pots, trash containers, and
cart toppers for originator flights
- Additional loading effort for coffee brew pots, trash containers, and cart
toppers onto catering truck
- Galley placement of coffee brew pots, trash containers, and cart toppers
during on-board exchange
Excluded activities:
- Packing of cart toppers included in Equipment preparation.
- Loading items in routine exchanges for turn flights, such as food and
beverage carts included in Last mile.
- Additional originator drive time included in Terminator drive time and strip
- In-kitchen washing of trash containers and coffee brew pots included in a
separate price within Class II ware washing

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: SVC, ONBOARD COORDINATOR

Component.ComponentDescription: Service Other Transprtation

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Included activities:
- Overseeing and coordinating loading of scheduled items onto the aircraft
- Assisting in transfer of catering equipment, if applicable
- Ensuring that scheduled items are loaded onto the aircraft and loaded into
appropriate positions
- Complete handover to flight crew
- Presence until passenger boarding doors are closed

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: STG, B772, CC, BASE FEE, PER FLIGHT INTL

Component.ComponentDescription: SERVICE STAGING

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Staging Included Services:
Movement and staging of carts, carriers and transport carts and waste
containers from beverage, equipment and food packing areas to final staging or
dock area.
Verification of all contents are present and accurately provisioned.
Add and verify onboard menu guides and boarding bills for the flight class
Packing of dry and wet ice into carts, drawers (except ice cream drawers) and
tubs
Not included
Dry Ice for Ice Cream drawers - See Plating
Packing of Galley carts, carriers and transport carts
Loading catering trucks with full flight contents - See SC Last Mile

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: WSHII, CLASS II, B772, CC, 2 MEAL

Component.ComponentDescription: SERVICE CLASS II WASH

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Included Services:
-Separating material left on trays/drawers between rotables, trash and recycling
-Disposing of trash separated from wares during ware washing activities per
local guidelines for domestic and international refuse
-Recovering and sorting identified as recoverable
-Moving Class I wares from carts to dishwashers
-Wash, cleaning and sanitization of Class II wares
Drying Class II wares
-Separating and staging linens for lick up by designated launderer
-Inspecting Class II for cleanliness
-Ensuring Class II wares are suitable for reloading onto new flight; if any
require repair, tag and handle appropriately
Excluded Services:
-Receiving laundry - See Receiving
-Linen laundering handled under separate agreement
-Repacking of recovered items under Cart Packing
-Recycling program under separate agreement

-Inspecting Class II for cleanliness
-Ensuring Class II wares are suitable for reloading onto new flight; if any
require repair, tag and handle appropriately
Excluded Services:
-Receiving laundry - See Receiving
-Linen laundering handled under separate agreement
-Repacking of recovered items under Cart Packing
-Recycling program under separate agreement

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: WSHI, CLASS I, B772, CC, MEAL

Component.ComponentDescription: SERVICE WASH I

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Charge to appear on boarding segment only for outboard flight - will not appear
on down line sectors
"Included Activities
Moving Class I equipment from the incoming dock to the equipment washing area
Washing and cleaning all Class I equipment
Drying Class I equipment
Ensuring Class I equipment is suitable to be reloaded onto a new flight
If equipment requires repair, further inspection or to be retired the equipment
should be tagged and handled accordingly
Excluded:
Serving equipment washing (covered under ware washing)
Trash disposal or incineration (covered under trash code)
Onboard exchange of equipment (covered under exchange)"

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: TRANS, B772, CC, DELIVERY, PER UPLIFT INTL

Component.ComponentDescription: SERVICE TRANSPORTATION

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Multi-sector operations only receive single transportation charge
"Included activities:
Loading catering truck(s) with flight content
Ensuring trucks are equipped with an extended delay snack drawer in case the
aircraft needs to be replenished
Driving full flight contents to the aircraft and driving back the stripped
contents from the inbound
Gaining access to airport premises, if applicable
Opening plane doors as necessary prior to exchange and closing of plane doors
as necessary after completion of exchange
Removing carts, carriers, freeload and any other items from the incoming flight
segment that must be stripped from the galleys
Loading carts, carriers, freeload and any other items into the designated
positions in the aircraft galleys repositioning as necessary to ensure secure
fit
Verifying whether the extended delay snack drawer requires replenishing and
replenish as needed
On aircraft waste container/trash cart bag removal and re-lining
Wait time to execute logistics (e.g. AOA access, ramp side wait, etc.)
Unloading of truck with stripped contents at designated dock location
Use of planeside exchange trucks within regular aircraft exchanges
Excluded Activities
Staging activities - See Staging
Additional drive to the aircraft due to terminator exchange See Other
Transportation
Operation of a roving van - See Other Transportation
Unscheduled Van/Lift/Truck - See Other Transportation"

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: CPK, B772, CC, 2 MEAL

Component.ComponentDescription: SERVICE CART PACKING

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Each class catered flight segment will incur a separate cart packing charge
assigned to the boarding facility
No Cart packing fee will be allocated for flights where the boarding facility
is only providing milk, beverages or pilot meals.
Included Services:
Runners required to bring necessary equipment and food/beverage product to cart
packing areas.
Fore items that are scheduled in a drawer, tray, tub or basket Item code do
incur a drawer packing fee:
-Picking up completed scheduled drawers, trays, tubs, baskets, TSUs and other
trays from speed racks or other interim staging locations, in preparation for
cart packing.
-Packing scheduled drawers, completed TSUs, other trays, filled bulk pack pans,
tubs and other containers into carts carriers or freeload transportation carts.
For items that are not scheduled in a drawer, tray, tub, or basket Item Code
and do not incur a drawer packing fee:
-Any preparatory work required prior to loading items into drawers or trays
that is not separately accounted in Equip Prep charges e.g.
--Lining service trays as needed
--Any required prep for lapkins or table sets prior to packing in cart
--Wrapping glass carafes
--Wrapping aseptic dairy drawers for overnight terminators
-Packing individually scheduled items into drawers or trans
packing filled drawers and trays into carts, carriers or freeload
transportation carts
Excluded Activities:
Packing of scheduled drawers, tubs & trays
Separately accounted equipment activities
Final staging of the full sets of carts for a flight
Add and verify onboard menu guides and boarding bills for the flight

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: ENT, CC, PP, INDIAN VEGETABLE KORMA, BASMATI RICE, BLANCHED MINI OKRA, PARATHA BREAD, VEGETARIAN, CY3, VGTB

Component.ComponentDescription: BOWL, LARGE, AA OWNED
INDIAN VEGETABLE KORMA, BASMATI RICE, BLANCHED MINI OKRA, PARATHA BREAD, VEGETARIAN
ALUMINUM, WRAP, COATED, VEGETABLE, COOKING SPRAY

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - ENTREE WILL ARRIVE FROM VENDOR PACKED IN FOIL TIN.
- REMOVE ENTREE FROM TIN.
- PORTION RICE VERTICALLY ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE BOWL.
- PORTION PORTION KORMA VERTICALLY ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE BOWL.
- PLACE THE OKRA IN THE CENTER OF THE BOWL STANDING UP.
- PLACE THE PARATHA BREAD HALVES CROSSING EACH OTHER IN THE BOTTOM CENTER OF
THE BOWL.
- COVER WITH FOIL WRAP.
- BOARD IN DESIGNATED LOCATION.

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: NOTE: PLEASE THE USE APPROPRIATE DRAWER FOR AIRCRAFT TYPE.
PLACE 3 CHAMPAGNE IN 1 DRAWER. WEAVE 1 PAD THROUGH BOTTLES. PLACE 1 PAD ON

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: STG, MEAL ORDERING SERVICE, PER FLIGHT FEE, INTL

Component.ComponentDescription: SERVICE STAGING

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Meal Ordering Included Services:
-Run passenger forecasts by cabin using AA systems
-Input forecasted passenger counts into Sabre automatic meal ordering system
(AMOS)
-Validate and monitor meal counts, including monitoring of pre-orders, special
meals, etc.
-Generate pre-order and special meals paper lists, if applicable
-Notate onboard menu guides with counts of each entree choice

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: ORIG, ADDITIONAL TERM EQUIP WASHING WB

Component.ComponentDescription: SERVICE CLASS II WASH

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: Terminator coffee brew pot and trash container washing is charged per
terminator flight for which the service is performed.
Included and excluded activities for Wide Body aircraft
Covers washing services performed for coffee brew pots and trash containers on
terminators only. This is accounted separately because these pieces of
equipment are only removed and washed once per day.
Included activities:
- Moving coffee brew pots and trash containers from the incoming dock to
washing station(s).
- Washing and cleaning all coffee brew pots and trash containers.
- Drying coffee brew pots and trash containers.
- Lining trash containers.
- Ensuring that coffee brew pots and trash containers are suitable to be
reloaded onto a new flight; if the equipment requires repair, further
inspection or should be retired from use, it is to be marked and handled
accordingly.
--This does not limit the responsibility of additional routine equipment checks
at other points in the value chain

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: BDL, ORIGINATOR LIQ RE-PACKING NON-LIQ PACKING FAC ONLY, CC

Component.ComponentDescription: SERVICE - DRAWER PACKING BEVERAGES

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: The Originator liquor re-packing fee is incurred at non-liquor packing stations
only, per class on an originator flight for which the service is performed.
There are three prices which defined by the class of service: FC, CC or YC. For
flights where premium economy (WC) is sold, the main cabin fee should cover
the activities performed for both main cabin and premium economy.
Included and excluded activities
The Originator liquor re-packing charge covers the removal, clean-up, and
repacking of liquor drawer contents for originators at non-liquor packing
stations.
Included activities:
- Removing contents of liquor drawers, cleaning drawer, and reorganizing and
repacking liquor drawers to spec as possible; please note drawer is not topped
off because this is not used for liquor packing stations
- Ensuring that liquor drawers and carts are packed and prepared in a manner
that is ready to be staged and boarded.
- Holding liquor drawers and carts in catering facility as necessary until
equipment is staged and boarded.
- Re-icing alcoholic beverage drawers as needed.
Excluded activities:
- Staging liquor carts included in 5B Staging
- Removing liquor carts from galley and transporting back to catering facility
included in 6A Last mile
- Loading and unloading liquor carts from truck included in 6A Last mile
- Drive time between catering facility and aircraft included in 6A Last mile

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - WASH APPLE AND DRAIN.
- CORE APPLE.
- CUT APPLE LONGWISE INTO 8 EQUAL WEDGES.
- DO NOT PREPARE IN ADVANCE. PREPARE AND ADD IMMEDIATELY
TO MAIN RECIPE WHICH HAS CITRIC ACID TO PREVENT FRUIT
FROM TURNING BROWN.

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - WASH ORANGE AND DRAIN.

OUTER MEMBRANE IS REMOVED.
- CUT ORANGE LONGWISE INTO 8 EQUAL WEDGES.
- COVER AND REFRIGERATE UNTIL NEEDED.
NOTE:
- WEIGHT VARIANCE FOR EACH WEDGE IS .29 OZ TO .45 OZ.

White Lapkin Grey Button Hole LAPKIN,

SPOON, PREMIUM, STAINLESS, FC/CC, AA OWNED

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - PLACE LINEN UNFOLDED ON FLAT SURFACE WITH SHORT EDGE CLOSEST TO YOU.
- PLACE FLATWARE IN MIDDLE OF LINEN HORIZONTALLY.
- FOLD LEFT AND RIGHT EDGES OVER FLATWARE TO MIDDLE OF LINEN, LEAVING A SPACE
OF APPROXIMATELY 1 IN. (2.54 CM) IN THE MIDDLE BETWEEN EACH EDGE.
- FOLD BOTTOM EDGE TO TOP EDGE.
- ROLL FLATWARE FROM TOP TO BOTTOM EDGE.
- SECURE WITH RED BAND.

White Lapkin Grey Button Hole LAPKIN,
SPOON, PREMIUM, STAINLESS, FC/CC, AA OWNED

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - LAY LINEN NAPKIN FLAT, HEM SIDE UP.
- STACK KNIFE, THEN FORK, THEN SPOON.
- PLACE FLATWARE IN CENTER OF NAPKIN, LENGTHWISE, ABOUT 2" FROM BOTTOM.

- FOLD UP THE BOTTOM 2" OF LINEN OVER THE FLATWARE.
- GRASP THE STACKED FLATWARE AND ROLL UP THE LINEN TIGHTLY.
- WRAP NAPKIN BAND AROUND ROLLUP AND SECURE.
- PLACE NAPKIN SEAM SIDE DOWN ONTO THE TRAY SET-UP WITH NAPKIN BAND LOGO
CUSTOMER FACING.

- ADD TOMATOES AND SAUTE FOR 30 SECONDS UNTIL SKIN
POPS AND BEGINS TO BLISTER.
- SPRINKLE SALT ON TOMATOES AND STIR TO INCORPORATE.
- REMOVE FROM HEAT AND BLAST CHILL AS PER HACCP.
- ONCE CHILLED, COVER, LABEL, AND REFRIGERATE.

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: CUCUMBER, ENGLISH, SLICED, (METRIC)

Component.ComponentDescription: CUCUMBER, ENGLISH, FRESH, NOT BRAND SPECIFIC, LOCAL PURCHASE

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - PREPARE ITEM ACCORDING TO RECIPE.
- SANITIZE THE PRODUCE FOLLOWING HACCP GUIDELINES PRIOR TO PRODUCTION.
- PLACE THE CUCUMBER ON A CLEAN CUTTING BOARD.
- USING A SHARP CHEFS KNIFE REMOVE A .5 INCH FROM BOTH ENDS OF CUCUMBER AND
DISCARD.
- CUTS THE CUCUMBER INT EQUAL SLICES.
- TRANSFER CUCUMBER INTO CLEAN CONTAINER, COVER, LABEL AND DATE THE CONTAINER.
- KEEP REFRIGERATED UNTIL USE AS PER HACCP.

SpecificationDetail.SpecificationDescription: ORZO PASTA, COOKED, (METRIC)

Component.ComponentDescription: OIL, VEGETABLE, EXTENDED LIFE, BRAKES, LOCAL PURCHASE, (METRIC)
WATER, FLOZ/ML
SALT, BULK, OZ/G
PASTA, ORZO, OZ/G

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - PREPARE ITEMS PER RECIPE.
- BRING THE WATER TO THE BOIL IN A SAUCE PAN.
- ADD THE SALT & ORZO PASTA.
- BRING TO THE BOIL.
- LOWER THE HEAT AND SIMMER GENTLY UNTIL COOKED.
- COOKING TIME CAN VARY - CHECK AFTER 5 MINUTES.
- THE PASTA SHOULD BE AL DENTE, BUT NOT RAW.
- DRAIN & REFRESH.
- MIX IN THE OIL.
- CHILL.
- COVER AND STORE PER HACCP.

MINT, FRESH, CHOPPED, OZ/G

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - PREPARE ITEMS PER RECIPE.
- FINELY CHOP THE HERBS.
- CHOP THE CAPERS, GARLIC & ANCHOVY.
- MIX 1 & 2 TOGETHER IN A BOWL.
- SLOWLY ADD THE OIL TO THE HERB MIX.
- PROCESS A 1/4 OF THE MIX & ADD BACK TO THE REST OF THE DRESSING.
- SEASON.
- CHILL & USE AS REQUIRED.
- COVER AND STORE PER HACCP.

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - PREPARE ITEMS PER RECIPE.
- PLACE TART SHELL ON CLEAN WORK SURFACE.
- EVENLY SPREAD BOURSIN CHEESE COVERING THE BOTTOM OF THE TART SHELL.
- TOP BOURSIN RANDOMLY WITH RED TOMATOES.
- TOP BOURSIN RANDOMLY WITH YELLOW TOMATOES.
- RANDOMLY PLACE RADISH BETWEEN TOMATOES SO STICKING UP.
- SPRINKLE TART WITH CHIVES.
- CHILL, WRAP, LABEL.

TextBlock.TextLineOfData: - PREPARE ITEMS PER RECIPE.
- 522 GMS = 14 ASPARAGUS SPEARS.
- TRIM TO 70 MM IN LENGTH.
- COOK IN BOILING WATER FOR 90 SECONDS
- REFRESH IN ICE COLD WATER.
- DRAIN & SEASON & MIX WITH THE OIL.
- GRILL OFF ON THE GRIDDLE.
- CHILL DOWN.
- COVER AND STORE PER HACCP.
